chapter.title: Chapter 1
Vision Against Edom
chapter.verse: The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord Yahweh says about Edom: We have heard a report from Yahweh, and a messenger has been sent among the nations saying, "Get up! Let's rise against her for battle!"
Look, I have made you small among the nations; you are utterly despised.
Your heart's pride has deceived you—you who live in the clefts of the rock, in your high dwelling, saying to yourself, "Who can bring me down to the ground?"
Even if you soar like an eagle and set your nest among the stars, I will bring you down from there—this is Yahweh's declaration.
chapter.title: Edom's Complete Destruction
chapter.verse: If thieves came to you, if robbers came at night—how you have been destroyed!—wouldn't they steal only what they needed? If grape gatherers came to you, wouldn't they leave some grapes behind?The Hebrew word for "grape gatherers" is בֹּצְרִים (botsrim), referring to those who harvest grapes during the vintage season.
How Esau has been searched out! His hidden treasures have been sought after!

All your allies have driven you to the border; your friends have deceived and overpowered you. Those who eat your bread set a trap beneath you—there is no understanding in him.The Hebrew מָזוֹר (mazor) means "trap" or "snare."
Won't I destroy the wise from Edom and understanding from Mount Esau on that day?—this is Yahweh's declaration.
Your mighty warriors will be terrified, Teman, so that everyone will be cut off from Mount Esau by slaughter.Teman was a region in Edom known for its wise men and warriors.
chapter.title: Judgment for Violence Against Jacob
chapter.verse: Because of the violence you did to your brother Jacob, shame will cover you, and you will be cut off forever.
On the day you stood aloof, on the day strangers captured his wealth, when foreigners entered his gates and cast lots for Jerusalem—you were like one of them.

You should not have gloated over your brother on the day of his misfortune, and you should not have rejoiced over the people of Judah on the day of their destruction. You should not have spoken arrogantly on the day of distress.

You should not have entered the gate of my people on the day of their disaster. You should not have gloated—yes, you!—over their misery on the day of their disaster, and you should not have seized their wealth on the day of their disaster.
You should not have stood at the crossroads to cut off their fugitives, and you should not have handed over their survivors on the day of distress.
chapter.title: The Day of Yahweh
chapter.verse: For the day of Yahweh is near against all nations. As you have done, it will be done to you; your actions will return on your own head.
For just as you drank on my set apart mountain, all nations will drink continually. They will drink and gulp it down, and they will be as if they had never existed.
chapter.title: Israel's Restoration and Victory
chapter.verse: But on Mount Zion there will be those who escape, and it will be set apart for God; and the house of Jacob will take possession of their inheritance.

Then the house of Jacob will be fire, the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau will be stubble. Jacob and Joseph will set them ablaze and consume them. No survivor will remain from the house of Esau, for Yahweh has spoken.

People from the Negev will possess Mount Esau; people from the foothills will possess the land of the Philistines. They will possess the territory of Ephraim and the territory of Samaria, and Benjamin will possess Gilead.

The exiles of this army of the Israelites who are among the Canaanites will possess the land as far as Zarephath, and the exiles from Jerusalem who are in Sepharad will possess the cities of the Negev.Zarephath was a Phoenician city between Tyre and Sidon. Sepharad's location is uncertain, but may refer to Sardis in Asia Minor.
Saviors will go up to Mount Zion to rule over Mount Esau, and the kingdom will belong to Yahweh.
